title: Alison Krauss & Union Station Announce First Album in 14 Years, Share New Song: Listen
description: Krauss and her band are following 2011’s Paper Airplane with the new album Arcadia
author: Walden Green
excerpt: Krauss and her band are following 2011’s Paper Airplane with the new album Arcadia
text: Alison Krauss & Union Station have announced a new album. Arcadia is the singer and fiddler’s first record with her band in 14 years, following 2011’s Paper Airplane. Listen to lead single “Looks Like the End of the Road” below.“Usually, I find something that's a first song, and then things fall into place,” Krauss said in a press statement. “That song was ‘Looks Like The End Of The Road.’ Jeremy Lister wrote it, and it just felt so alive—and as always, I could hear the guys already playing it."Arcadia is out March 28 via Down The Road. Following the release, Krauss & Union Station will embark on a massive, 75-date North American tour that will run through the end of September. Scroll down to see the full list of dates.Read about Alison Krauss & Union Station in the Sunday Review of the O Brother, Where Art Thou? soundtrack.All products featured on Pitchfork are independently selected by our editors. html:
Alison Krauss & Union Station have announced a new album. Arcadia is the singer and fiddler’s first record with her band in 14 years, following 2011’s Paper Airplane. Listen to lead single “Looks Like the End of the Road” below.

“Usually, I find something that's a first song, and then things fall into place,” Krauss said in a press statement. “That song was ‘Looks Like The End Of The Road.’ Jeremy Lister wrote it, and it just felt so alive—and as always, I could hear the guys already playing it."

Arcadia is out March 28 via Down The Road. Following the release, Krauss & Union Station will embark on a massive, 75-date North American tour that will run through the end of September. Scroll down to see the full list of dates.

Read about Alison Krauss & Union Station in the Sunday Review of the O Brother, Where Art Thou? soundtrack.

All products featured on Pitchfork are independently selected by our editors. However, when you buy something through our retail links, we may earn an affiliate commission.

Alison Krauss & Union Station: Arcadia

Arcadia:

10 There’s a Light Up Ahead
